creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
After fix to Bug 58756, default was used as the default policy.

But this is wrong as:
- HttpHC3Impl used "compabitility" as default
- HttpHC4Impl should use "standard" as default  (This explains the reported issue by Maxime Chassagneux on Mailing list related to dates parsing)

The issue is that when reading a 2.13 saved JMX from a 3.0, as default have changed, the default values are not in JMX file so we end up initializing different values.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Will be Fixed within Bug 58756

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 58756 ***

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Author: pmouawad

URL: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1732387&view=rev
Log:
Bug 58756 - CookieManager : Cookie Policy select box content must depend on Cookie implementation

After fix to Bug 58756, default was used as the default policy.

But this is wrong as:
- HttpHC3Impl used "compabitility" as default
- HttpHC4Impl should use "standard" as default  (This explains the reported
issue by Maxime Chassagneux on Mailing list related to dates parsing)
Bugzilla Id: 58756
